channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped household waste, 14th February
item.description:
Fly tipped household waste strewn across the grassed verge. Food, nappies and food packaging spread across verge and road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Longleigh Lane, Bexleyheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding in garage area, 14th February
item.description:
Two soak away drains need unblocking, taking forever, days in fact to soak away any water from the near constant rain we have had of late, resulting in the garage area being flooded. Not helped I guess by the nearby building site and the run off of mud from that.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewell Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees obstructing public highway, 14th February
item.description:
Highways Act 1980 (Section 154) Overhanging trees onto public highway causing danger and obstruction to pedestrians. Located on a busy route providing access to Beths grammar school, dangerous for children. Issue has been previously reported by others but no action taken, situation worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2A, Parkhurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shutters need cleaning, 14th February
item.description:
Businesses leave and ckose shutter and locals have to endure this vandalism. Please come and clean and let owners know they have a responsibility to the customers who live there. Also No 29 and No 26 - whole area needs cleaning and maintenance. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elsie Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Litter and food waste again has built up on the grass in front of Market Meadow., 14th February
item.description:
Litter and food waste again has built up on the grass in front of Market Meadow. We now have a rat problem, Please , would it be possoble to add this area of grass to the rosta when the the litter cleaners do the St. Mary Cray sign green in front of the Londis shop? It would really help tackle the daily issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Market Meadow, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous deep large craters, 14th February
item.description:
Reported numerous times and ignored by Bexley Council. These are an immediate danger to all road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Chislehurst Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London

item.description:

item.description:
Nuisance area if fly tipping. Abandoned shopping trolley . Please escalate this to council. This is becoming a fly tipping central
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Uneven footbridge footpath caused accident, 14th February
item.description:
There are gulleys on each side of the footpath on the footbridge by Bowes Park overground station. They are not marked by eg a white stripe. As a result I fell into one, and ended up with a severely sprained ankle. I am now awaiting a ligament operation as a result.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whittington Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unmarked gutters/gulleys on either side of path on footbridge over railway between Herbert Road and Myddelton Road., 14th February
item.description:
The 'gulleys' as I'll call them either side of the footpath over the bridge are not clearly marked, eg with a white stripe, to avoid pedestrians stumbling into them. I unfortunately did this, severely sprained an ankle and am now awaiting a ligament operation as a result. Noone (ie Haringey Council, the railway company, the station company) knows who's responsible for maintaining the footpath, please help!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines need repainting, 14th February
item.description:
The picture shown, Fairfield Road/Homesdale Road bend was some time ago, the lines are less visible now. The bend is a dangerous, blind 90 degree bend and discouraging parking on the bend is important - as with the double yellow lines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homesdale Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street signage for Ringo is too low on poles and could cause injury, 13th February
item.description:
Sadly, ever since Ringo signs were placed on Station Square and along Fairway they have been too low to the ground according to the UK Department for Transport Traffic Signs Manual which' require the standard mounting height for traffic signs is at least 2.15 meters from the lowest edge of the sign to the ground on footways', The good reason is apparent from the photographs, someone who is even on 1.52 meters in height could be seriously injured walking side on into these plates. I suggest that a safety audit of all these signs be undertaken and remedial action be taken as a matter of some urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Fairway, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of broken glass, 13th February
item.description:
There is lots of broken glass on the pavement opposite the anchor and hope pub this could be dangerous for children dogs and bikes

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): High Hill Ferry, Hackney, London
